node.title: World mourns 5 million COVID deaths
node.alt: A young Indian woman holding a portrait of her late mother.
node.description: The ABC spoke to five people from around the world about the toll COVID-19 has taken, both on their communities and on them personally.
node.content:
["Seema Awasthi was a beloved\u00a0teacher and school principal who single-handedly raised her two daughters.", "Her daughter Prachi describes her as someone who gave her all on the cricket pitch; she had a \"passion for life\" and\u00a0was planning an all-girls getaway with her adult children.", "\"[She was] such a sweet person who has transformed countless lives \u2026 it is really truly impossible to replace her,\" Prachi says.", "The last message she received from her mother was at 6:40pm on the night of April 23.", "Seema died a few hours later.", "She was one of at least 21 other COVID-19 patients in critical care unit of a hospital in north-west Delhi who died that night, allegedly due to lack of oxygen at the facility.", "", "
Prachi says her mother would still be alive if not for the alleged lack of oxygen.(ABC News: Som Patidar)
", "\"That night, I can literally never forget,\" Prachi says.", "Prachi's mother is just one of the 5 million COVID-19 related deaths officially recorded, according to the Johns Hopkins University\u00a0tally, though some estimates suggest the true number is likely much, much higher.", "The ABC spoke with people in five different parts of the world \u2014\u00a0India, Italy, China, Indonesia and Papua New Guinea \u2014\u00a0about the\u00a0devastation the pandemic has wrought on their communities, and about the loved ones they have lost.", "", "
Like thousands of others in India, Seema's body was burned at a makeshift crematorium.(Reuters:\u00a0Danish Siddiqui)
", "The deeply personal loss for Prachi and her sister has been replicated on a scale almost too immense to fathom.", "\"It is a very disturbing thought,\" Prachi says, reflecting on the grim milestone.", "\"I'm not saying our loss or our sorrow is in any way less or more than other people, all the 5 million people who lost their lives.\"", "
Delhi, India
", "", "
India's COVID crisis was marked by oxygen shortages and mass cremations.(ABC News: Graphic by Jarrod Fankhauser)
", "Prachi remembers being very careful at the start of the pandemic \u2014\u00a0she wouldn't let her mother go out at first \u2014\u00a0but there was little knowledge about COVID-19, or what lay ahead.", "But a year later, the Delta variant emerged.\u00a0", "\"We had not thought of any destruction at a mass level, or people dying like this, literally dying on the street,\" she says.", "Prachi says\u00a0her mother would still be here if it weren't for the oxygen shortage.", "Doctors had informed the family that Seema was recovering \u2014\u00a0she still needed oxygen, but not as frequently \u2014\u00a0and in video calls they could hear the tone in her voice had changed for the better.", "", "
Seema Awasthi told her daughters she would be \"dancing home\" from hospital during a video call.(Supplied)
", "But the family received a call that Seema had been put on a ventilator. They rushed to the hospital, where a doctor informed them\u00a0Seema had passed away, despite attempts to resuscitate her.", "\"That night was extremely traumatic \u2026 it was almost a riot-like situation, a lot of emotions going all through the place,\" she says.", "Dr D K Baluja, the hospital's medical superintendent, told local media at the time that a critical oxygen tanker did not arrive that night.", "Prachi says at that point, families should have been told so they could try and source oxygen themselves.", "", "
Prachi hopes a fact-finding panel can help give families like hers some closure.(ABC News: Som Patidar)
", "\"If we couldn't get a cylinder, that's a separate story \u2013 that's a separate feeling that you live with, but at least you live with knowing that you tried, right?\"", "\"We were robbed of that opportunity to even try.\"", "
Wuhan, China
", "", "
The first COVID-19 deaths were recorded in China.\u00a0(ABC News: Jarrod Fankhauser)
", "Zhang Hai was one of the first people in the world to lose a loved one to COVID-19.", "His father, Zhang Lifa, was an army veteran who worked on China's nuclear weapons program. He died one month shy of his 77th birthday.", "At the time of his death, on February 1, 2020, he was one of just 304 people to have died with the novel coronavirus.", "", "
Mr Zhang has not yet buried the ashes of his father, Zhang Lifa.(Supplied: Zhang Hai)
", "Back then, the new disease did not\u00a0even have a name \u2014\u00a0it would be officially called COVID-19 10 days later, on February 11, and the World Health Organization (WHO) would not declare a global pandemic until a month after that, on March 11.", "Although many Wuhan residents want answers as they mourn their family members who died early in the pandemic, Mr Zhang is one of few who will talk to foreign media due to the fear of being harassed by authorities.", "\"I am a Chinese citizen who is very patriotic, but loving the country doesn't mean that I can't ask for accountability,\" Mr Zhang says.", "\"The virus\u00a0spread\u00a0all around the world. It has taken so many people's lives in such a serious manner.\"", "", "
Zhang Hai is still speaking out about his father's death, but other grieving families say they have been silenced.(AP: Ng Han Guan)
", "Mr Zhang has yet to bury his father's ashes, a custom that would allow him to rest in peace.", "\"But your son is not a coward.", "\"To everyone who lost their loved ones during the pandemic, please be strong and take care of yourself.", "\"I hope we can all do our best to urge our governments to call for an investigation into\u00a0COVID-19, regardless of\u00a0our nationality or ethnicity.\"", "
Cremona, Italy
", "", "
Italy was one of the first countries to introduce lockdowns to stem the spread of COVID-19.\u00a0(ABC News: Graphic by Jarrod Fankhauser)
", "Cremona was known as the \"city of violins\", but in March last year the city and\u00a0the broader region of Lombardy were instead associated with a deadly and swift COVID-19 outbreak.", "In early April of 2020,\u00a0violinist Lena Yokoyama stood on top of the iconic bell tower in Cremona, playing a hauntingly beautiful tune over eerily empty streets.", "A few days later, Yokoyama would play her violin again, this time on the roof of a hospital where healthcare workers were battling to control infections with limited personal protection equipment (PPE).", "Shortly after, on April 19, 2020, neurologist Dr Luciano Abruzzi breathed his last.", "\"The first patient of my career was my father, ill with COVID, an unknown disease that brought the whole world to its knees, affecting millions of people,\" his son, Dr Dario Abruzzi, says.", "", "
Dario Abruzzi, right, pictured with his late father. Dario was among Lombardy healthcare workers invited to the Vatican by the Pope and honoured for their sacrifice.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "His father became infected\u00a0in mid-March. At first Dario had treated him in an isolated room at home with an oxygen tank, but he was forced to take him to the hospital's emergency room.", "The day the elder Dr Abruzzi was intubated and admitted to the ICU was also the day Dario became a fully-fledged doctor.", "\"His last message to me that morning upon hearing the news was, 'Well done! This is just the beginning \u2026 now it's your turn!'\" Dario says.", "", "
Dario says he was always proud of his father Dr\u00a0Luciano Abruzzi, who taught him you have to be a good person before you can be a good doctor.(Supplied)
", "\"In those moments I realised that I would become what he had ceased to be: a doctor loved, respected by all, who could give his life for his work and for his patients.\"", "The late Dr Abruzzi\u00a0was also fondly remembered by his friends, Dr Giovanna Bianchini and her husband Dr Paolo Bodini \u2014\u00a0a former mayor of Cremona \u2014\u00a0who both became sick with COVID-19 in March last year.", "", "
Dr Paolo Bodini and Dr Giovanna Bianchini say the outbreak in Italy in February 2020 was a shock.(Supplied)
", "They recovered and are now volunteering to help vaccinate refugees and immigrants who are often overlooked in the healthcare system.", "Dr Bianchini remembers Cremona becoming \"a ghost town \u2014\u00a0totally silent, except for awfully frequent ambulance sirens.\"", "But the couple say the memories of the violin music and people reaching out to one another from their balconies saw \"a spirit of community\" spring out in\u00a0lockdown.", "\"It really helped the population to feel there was solidarity, that there was a feeling of being a nation that was fighting against an invisible enemy,\" Dr Bodini\u00a0says.", "
Port Moresby, PNG
", "", "
Morgues are full in PNG, which is suffering a devastating COVID outbreak amid low vaccination rates.\u00a0(ABC News: Graphic\u00a0by Jarrod Fankhauser, photo by Pidgin Production/UNFPA)
", "Joanne Schulz, a mother of four,\u00a0became Papua New Guinea's first local COVID-19 case in March 2020.", "She still doesn't know how she caught the virus.", "Her identity was leaked soon after her diagnosis, leaving her \"dumbfounded\" and \"lost\".", "\"They wanted me removed from the village because at the time we didn't have an isolation facility.", "\"I think the biggest fear is being a mother and wondering, 'How do you protect your children \u2026 from the public and from stigma?'\"", "", "
Joanne Schulz was the first case of local transmission in PNG.(Supplied)
", "Misinformation and conspiracy theories have been rife in PNG since the early days of the global pandemic.", "It is now experiencing its third and most deadly wave \u2013 with reports morgues are full and some towns have run out of coffins.", "PNG has one of the world's lowest vaccination rates, with just 3\u00a0per cent of the eligible population vaccinated.", "That has been blamed not on a lack of supply, but misinformation which has sparked widespread vaccine hesitancy.", "Ms Schulz has been volunteering as a health worker for many years, after she was shot in the face in 2014.", "", "
Joanne Schulz has been educating people on remote islands in PNG about COVID-19.(Supplied)
", "The bullet pierced her cheeks and damaged her tongue, leaving her unable to speak for several weeks. But she vowed to God she would work as a volunteer.", "Like Dr Bodini and Dr Bianchini in Italy, now she is helping with her country's\u00a0vaccination drive.", "\"There's\u00a0a flow of people turning up to get vaccinated so [it's] a very positive outcome for now.\"", "
Jakarta, Indonesia
", "", "
Indonesia suffered a devastating Delta wave.(ABC News: Jarrod Fankhauser)
", "Razan Akhmad Gassani remembers fondly the weekends he spent with his parents and his brother earlier this year.", "The tight-knit family would spend hours cycling on their bikes together at Jakarta's sports complex.", "\"That is the best memory that I have now \u2014 spending time with my mum,\" he says.", "His mother, Aslinda Idris, 56, died on August 8 this year after spending five weeks in hospital with COVID-19.", "It happened during the\u00a0devastating Delta wave in Indonesia, which recorded a peak of more than 50,000 daily infections in mid-July.", "", "
Razan (left) with his father Bakhtiar Effendi, mother Aslinda Idris and brother Randy Arrahman.(Supplied)
", "The country has recorded more than 4.2 million cases of COVID-19, and more than 143,000 deaths.", "\"We did not know how she got the virus. She was sick for a week before getting tested,\" Razan says.", "While his mother appeared to be improving in the fourth week of her hospitalisation, her oxygen saturation levels dropped and she quickly deteriorated.", "\"The doctor said that her lungs were severely damaged because of the virus,\" he says.", "", "
Indonesia has recorded more than 140,000 deaths.(Reuters:\u00a0Willy Kurniawan)
", "Two months after losing his mother, Razan says the family is trying to adjust to life without her.", "His father, Bakhtiar Effendi, is bereft. He has hidden the bikes away because they remind him of his wife.", "\"Now my dad is thinking to get back to work so he doesn't need to think about my mum daily,\" he says.", "
Families fighting for justice
", "For some who have lost a parent to COVID-19, like Zhang Hai and Prachi Awasthi, their loss has morphed into a larger search for answers.", "The fight for Seema's life has transformed into one for recognition for Prachi and other relatives mourning those who died that night.", "", "
Prachi Awasthi is one of many families still seeking closure.(ABC News: Som Patidar)
", "The official hospital forms only state whether the death was COVID-related, not if it was due to a lack of oxygen at the facility.", "A fact-finding panel has been set up to investigate the deaths caused by the alleged oxygen shortage during the peak of India's Delta outbreak, but it will primarily focus on compensation for the families and won't make findings on liability.", "\"[It's] that little sense of closure that people might get if we are able to win this fight for justice,\" Prachi says.", "\"Right now it's very difficult to wrap your head around the fact that something like this has happened. I personally still can't believe it. I still feel that my mum is there.\"", "", "
Prachi finds it hard to believe her mother is gone.(ABC News: Som Patidar)
"]
